Agent.Description: The entity that performs the action of cutting.
Characteristics: Performs the intentional act of cutting.
Can be human, animal, or machine.

Object.Description: The item or material being acted upon that undergoes separation or division.
Characteristics: Directly affected by the cutting action.
Its physical structure is altered as a result.

Tool.Description: The implement or means used to perform the cutting action.
Characteristics: Facilitates force or precision by the agent.

Location.Description: The spatial setting where the cutting action occurs.

Goal.Description: The intended result or purpose of the cutting action.
Characteristics: Relates to creating smaller pieces, shapes, or components.
Examples: Crafting a sculpture or harvesting crops.

Result.Description: The state or condition of the object after the cutting action.
Characteristics: Describes how the object has been transformed.
Examples: Trimmed branches or cut fabric patterns.

Force.Description: The physical energy applied to enable the cutting action.
Characteristics: Can be manual, mechanical, or electrical.
Examples: Motor power in a chainsaw or laser energy.

Circumstances.Description: Additional contextual details surrounding the cutting action.
Examples: Quickly cutting paper in an arts-and-crafts session.

Recipient.Description: The entity that benefits from or receives the results of the cutting action.
Characteristics: May influence how the action is performed.

Medium.Description: The substance or environment through which the tool operates to perform the cut.
